title: "Air & heat" casual block letters, similar to Gusto Black or Churchward Freedom
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202191339im_/http:/typophile.com/files/airheat_3738.jpg)

This font is very similar to Gusto Black by Bob Alonso and Churchward Freedom by Joseph Churchward but the difference is the slant to the "A", the angle to the ends of the crosspieces on the "E" and "T" and the curve of and drop on the tail of the "R".

I do not know if the "&" is from the same font or was borrowed from another.  
This is a vinyl sign.

Kevin
author: huntunlimited

comments.content: Looks House-y to me. But I don't know which font.

That isn't good enough to be House\*, but I see what you mean Patty. Maybe it reminds you of [Burbank](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202191339/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=565).

\*No offense to whomever it ends up belonging to.
